text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm dilip venkatesh a senior
technical account manager here at the
AWS offices in North Carolina
today I am going to show you how to find
the IP address ranges used by Amazon
simple storage service let's get started
download the Json file that contains all
AWS IP address ranges
to find the Json download refer to the
knowledge Center article Linked In the
video's description
open this Json file in a browser or a
text editor of your choice
then search the file for the string
service S3
for this example I have created a
Windows ec2 instance and a Linux ec2
instance
but you can complete all the steps using
Powershell on Windows and a terminal on
Mac
on Linux or Mac OS machines you can use
a tool such as JQ tool to parse the Json
response
JQ is a lightweight and flexible command
line Json processor
this command line utility can slice
filter and transform the components of a
Json file
you can install JQ using this command
for example this command parses the Json
file for all ipv4 addresses used by
Amazon S3
for another example this command parses
the Json response for all ipv4 addresses
used by Amazon S3 in a specific AWS
region in this case it is Us East one
on Windows operating systems you can use
AWS tools for Powershell
in Powershell run this command to
install AWS tools
the get AWS public IP address range
command filters for all ipv4 addresses
used by Amazon S3
the get AWS public IP address range
command filters for all ipv4 addresses
used by Amazon S3 in a specific AWS
region in this case it is Us East one
so now you know how to find the IP
address ranges used by Amazon S3 on
Linux or Windows using the JQ tool or
Powershell commands
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
